unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Linear Transformations of a Random Variable
question_text:
Suppose $X$ is a random variable whose mean is $12.5$ and whose standard deviation is $2.1$.
Let $Y = 6.2X – 7$.
What are the mean and the variance of $Y$?
solution:
The random variable Y has been formed through a linear transformation of X involving both multiplication and subtraction.

Multiplication affects both the mean and the variance of X, while subtraction only affects the mean. Here are the rules:

If Y=aX−b:
